entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 8:19PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water Levels Through the Weekend... Runoff from rainfall and remaining snowmelt will cause rivers draining the Brooks Range to rise to bankfull and possibly overbank in some low lying areas into the weekend. The high water will cover gravel bars and push water up to the brush line. Those living or recreating along rivers draining the Brooks Range are

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 11:48AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...UNSEASONABLY STRONG STORM TO BRING GUSTY WINDS AND HEAVY RAIN SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY... A strong area of low pressure (982 mb) in the North Pacific will arrive over the Alaska Peninsula Saturday afternoon. The front associated with this low will lift northward and extend across the northern Gulf coast from Kodiak Island to Prince William Sound.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Kodiak Island; Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 11:47AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...UNSEASONABLY STRONG STORM TO BRING GUSTY WINDS AND HEAVY RAIN SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY... A strong area of low pressure (982 mb) in the North Pacific will arrive over the Alaska Peninsula Saturday afternoon. Gusty winds and heavy rain are expected. The heaviest precipitation will fall along the Alaska Range. Excessive rainfall over low lying areas

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 8:22AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water Levels On Rivers and Streams... Recent warm temperatures are resulting in siginifcant snowmelt runoff in the far northwestern Brooks Range. This is causing some rivers and streams to rise to bankfull levels and possibly overbank in low lying areas. The pulse of high water is currently moving down the Wulik River and the crest is expected to reach

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 4:23PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE... * Thunderstorm coverage will decrease going into this evening, before widespread showers and thunderstorms return for Saturday through Monday. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 11:57PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Beaver and northern Lipscomb Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1157 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Gate to 4 miles northeast of Darrouzett. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 09 at 10:51AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Green River near La Barge affecting Lincoln and Sublette Counties. .High-elevation snowmelt continues and automated snowpack estimates reveal about 4.5 inches of water remaining in the snowpack in the mountains around 9,500 feet west of La Barge. entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 09 at 10:44AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Bear River below Pixley Dam affecting Lincoln County. .High-elevation snowmelt, with snowpack remaining above 9,000 feet, continues.
